Pemprov DKI Resmi Naikkan UMP Tahun 2020 Sebesar Rp4,2 Juta
02 Nov 2019, 00:39 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Pemprov DKI Resmi Naikkan UMP Tahun 2020 Sebesar Rp4,2 Juta

KBRN, Jakarta : Pemerintah Provinsi (Pemprov) DKI Jakarta resmi menetapkan kenaikan upah minimum provinsi tahun 2020 sebanyak 8,51 persen, menjadi Rp4.267.349,906.Gubernur DKI Jakarta, Anies Baswedan menegaskan, penetapan UMP tersebut sesuai dengan dasar hukum yang berlaku. Baik itu undang undang dan peraturan yang berlaku lainnya."Kenaikannya sebesar Rp335.776. Atau kenaikannya 8,51 persen," seru Anies di Balai Kota Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Bukan hanya menaikkan UMP, lanjut Anies, buruh yang memiliki gaji setara UMP hingga 10 persen di atasnya juga akan mendapat kartu pekerja beserta sejumlah fasilitas lainnya.Fasilitas tersebut diantaranya adalah gratis menggunakan transportasi umum Jak Lingko, harga lebih murah saat belanja di Jak Grosir, Kartu Jakarta Pintar Plus serta kuota jalur afirmasi bagi buruh yang anaknya tengah mengenyam bangku sekolah. Pemprov DKI merencanakan untuk melibatkan serikat buruh untuk memperlancar distribusi kartu pekerja.Anies menjelaskan, Kartu Pekerja diberikan bertujuan untuk memperkecil selisih pendapatan dengan pengeluaran buruh ibu kota."Tujuan dari meningkatkan gaji supaya selisih pendapatan dan pengeluaran tidak besar. Kita lakukan dua-duanya di Jakarta. Bukan hanya gaji naik tapi pengeluarannya dikurangi," demikian Anies. (Foto : Tangkap Layar TV One)

DKI Provincial Government Officially Increases UMP in 2020 by Rp. 4.2 Million
02 Nov 2019, 00:39 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


DKI Provincial Government Officially Increases UMP in 2020 by Rp. 4.2 Million

KBRN, Jakarta: The Provincial Government (Pemprov) of DKI Jakarta officially set the provincial minimum wage increase in 2020 by 8.51 percent, to Rp4,267,349,906. The Governor of DKI Jakarta, Anies Baswedan asserted, the determination of the UMP was in accordance with the applicable legal basis. Both the law and other applicable regulations. "The increase amounted to Rp335,776. Or an increase of 8.51 percent," Anies exclaimed at the Jakarta City Hall, Friday (11/01/2019). Not just raising the UMP, continued Anies, labor who have a salary equivalent to UMP up to 10 percent on it will also get a worker's card along with a number of other facilities. Among them are free use of Jak Lingko public transportation, cheaper prices when shopping at Jak Wholesaler, Jakarta Smart Plus Card and affirmation path quota for workers whose child is attending school. DKI Provincial Government plans to involve trade unions to expedite the distribution of workers 'cards. Anies explained, the Workers' Card is given aiming to reduce the difference in income with capital expenditure for workers. "The purpose of increasing salaries so that the difference in income and expenses is not large. We do both in Jakarta "Not only increased salaries but reduced spending," said Anies.
